unverified.title: Your Backups Are Untested
unverified.subtitle: Hope is not a strategy. Verify every backup automatically.

problem.description: Most organizations take backups religiously but never test if they actually work. When disaster strikes, they discover their backups are corrupted or incomplete.
problem.story: We were backing up our Proxmox server regularly. One day we needed it, and when we tried to restore from backup, we couldn't because of data corruption. The problem was actually with the disk we were backing up to. Because we never tested it, we lost the entire system.
additionalPoints: Backup failures often go unnoticed until it's too late
Disk failures, network issues, or configuration errors can silently corrupt backups
Manual testing is time-consuming and rarely done consistently

solution.title: Automated Backup Verification
solution.description: Every backup is automatically verified by actually restoring and testing it. You get instant alerts if anything fails, not when you desperately need the backup.
benefits: Automatic verification of every backup taken
Real restoration tests, not just checksum validation
Instant alerts when backups fail verification
Portable backups that work across different hardware
Peace of mind knowing your backups actually work

limitedHistory.title: Your Data History Is Too Short
limitedHistory.subtitle: Store months of backup history without the storage nightmare.

problem.description: Traditional backup systems keep only a handful of full backups due to storage costs and complexity. Data that existed months ago can be permanently lost.
additionalPoints: Old backups are overwritten to save space
Finding data from several months ago becomes impossible
Differential and incremental strategies are complex and confusing

solution.title: Unlimited Retention with Incremental Efficiency
solution.description: Keep months or even years of backup history without the storage explosion. Our incremental deduplication means you only store what changed.
benefits: Store months of backup history efficiently
Recover data from any point in time
Incremental deduplication reduces storage by 90%+
Simple retention policies without complex differential/incremental setups
Cost-effective long-term archival

slowBackups.title: Your Backups Take Forever
slowBackups.subtitle: Incremental speed with full backup reliability. No compromises.

problem.description: Backing up large datasets remotely is often impossible or takes days. Systems fall behind, and backups never catch up with production changes.
problem.story: At one organization we worked with, backing up the current system took 2 weeks, while processing new daily data took 2 days. The backup system slowed everything down, and because traditional backup methods required full copies each time, we had to overwrite old backups due to insufficient storage capacity.
additionalPoints: Large datasets take days or weeks to backup remotely
Backup processes can slow down production systems
Systems fall perpetually behind as new data comes in faster than backups complete
Network bandwidth becomes a major bottleneck

solution.title: Incremental Speed, Full Backup Reliability
solution.description: After the first full backup, only changes are transferred. Large datasets stay in sync without the bandwidth nightmare.
benefits: Initial full backup, then only changes are synced
Backups complete in minutes instead of days
Minimal impact on production systems
Efficient use of network bandwidth
Always up-to-date without falling behind
